docs.title: Eks

Create an AWS EKS elastic kubernetes service cluster

  • Trusted Entity
  • EKS Cluster Policy
  • Cluster Configuration

docs.title: Elastic Kubernetes Service (GUI)
docs.text: Requirements - IAM Cluster Role for EKS - Configure Cluster in EKS page

docs.title: Trusted Entity
docs.text: { "Version": "2012-10-17", "Statement": [ { "Effect": "Allow", "Principal": { "Service": [ "eks.amazonaws.com" ] }, "Action": "sts:AssumeRole" } ] }

docs.title: Devops tools
docs.text:
• DevOps Tools
  • PowerShell Alias

docs.title: DevOps Tools
docs.text: This section will cover all of the individual tools utilized in DevOps to deploy HA applications. Some examples will be for Commercial, FedRamp'd, or multi-cloud environments. I'll do my best to let you know when and what.

docs.title: PowerShell Alias
docs.text: Set an alias in PowerShell set-alias -Name <short_name> -Value <original_name> Real world sample | terraform alias set-alias -Name t -Value terraform

docs.title: Transfer Project into another Project
docs.text: Open your repository, navigate to General Settings, Expand Advanced and in the Transfer project section, choose a new namespace.

docs.title: Backup recovery
docs.text:
• Importance
  • Backups
  • Synology
  • Recovery

docs.title: Importance
docs.text: Recovery - because backups aren't enough. Test your backups!

docs.title: Synology
docs.text: Using Hyper Backup by Synology in the app store, you can easily backup your local files (file share) to an AWS S3 bucket for pennies! Seriously, $1/month per 200GB transferred TO S3 with over 30 days of versions in my initial trial run.

docs.title: Terraform
docs.text:
Terraform offers a lot of great resources on their website which covers installation, building and destroying infrastructure.

Below, you'll find resources that helped me get started or common gotchas along the way.

docs.title: Terraform for AWS
docs.text: Here's the direct link to the AWS Provider documentation.

docs.title: Terminal
docs.text: Some of the best things about coding come when you have the ability to customize your dev environment.

docs.title: Alias
docs.text: terraform plan | apply | destroy = tf p | a | d
